thread.title: Fans fete 'Star Wars' on China’s Great Wall
thread.title_full: Fans fete 'Star Wars' on China’s Great Wall

title: Fans fete 'Star Wars' on China’s Great Wall
persons: JASON LEE/REUTERS JASON LEE/REUTERS JASON LEE/REUTERS JASON LEE/REUTERS JASON LEE/REUTERS JASON LEE/REUTERS JASON LEE/REUTERS JASON LEE/REUTERS JASON LEE/REUTERS
text:
Fans fete 'Star Wars' on China’s Great Wall Last updated 14:19, October 22 2015 JASON LEE/REUTERS JASON LEE/REUTERS JASON LEE/REUTERS JASON LEE/REUTERS JASON LEE/REUTERS JASON LEE/REUTERS JASON LEE/REUTERS JASON LEE/REUTERS JASON LEE/REUTERS 
A fan dressed as a character from "Star Wars" poses for a photo in front of five hundred replicas of the iconic Storm Troopers at the Juyongguan section of the Great Wall of China during a promotional event for "Star Wars: The Force Awakens" film, on the outskirts of Beijing. 
A fan dressed as a character from "Star Wars" poses for a photo in front of five hundred replicas of the Stormtrooper characters at the Juyongguan section of the Great Wall of China during a promotional event for "Star Wars: The Force Awakens" film, on the outskirts of Beijing. 
A fan dressed as an Imperial Royal Guard character from "Star Wars" poses for a photo in front of five hundred replicas of Stormtroopers at the Juyongguan section of the Great Wall of China. 
A fan holding a helmet of the Stormtrooper character from "Star Wars" poses for a group photo next to a cat at the Juyongguan section of the Great Wall of China during a promotional event for "Star Wars: The Force Awakens" film, on the outskirts of Beijing. 
Five hundred replicas of the Stormtrooper characters from "Star Wars" are seen on the steps at the Juyongguan section of the Great Wall of China during a promotional event for "Star Wars: The Force Awakens" film, on the outskirts of Beijing. 
Five hundred replicas of the Stormtrooper characters from "Star Wars" are seen on the steps at the Juyongguan section of the Great Wall of China during a promotional event for "Star Wars: The Force Awakens" film. 
Fans holding toy lightsabers arrive at Juyongguan section of the Great Wall of China for a promotional event for "Star Wars: The Force Awakens" film, on the outskirts of Beijing. 
Five hundred replicas of Stormtrooper characters from "Star Wars" are placed on the steps at the Juyongguan section of the Great Wall of China during a promotional event for "Star Wars: The Force Awakens". 
A fan holding a toy lightsaber poses for a photo in front of five hundred replicas of Stormtrooper characters at the Juyongguan section of the Great Wall of China. 1 of 9 « Previous « Previous Next » Next » 
Donning light sabers, "Star Wars" fans gathered at China's Great Wall ahead of the release of the highly-anticipated next episode of the sci-fi saga. 
A new trailer for "Star Wars: Episode VII - The Force Awakens" debuted this week during halftime of ESPN's National Football League game. 
A Chinese version trailer was later released at a Disney promotional event for the movie at the landmark Great Wall, where Stormtrooper figures were displayed. JASON LEE/REUTERS 
Five hundred replicas of the Stormtrooper characters from "Star Wars" are seen on the steps at the Juyongguan section of the Great Wall of China. 
READ MORE: 
*Star Wars fans treated to first ever flight on R2-D2 ANA JET 
More than 200 "Star Wars" fans attended. 
"Star Wars: Episode VII - The Force Awakens" is released in the United States in December and in China in January.
